column4: does it really matter if I have a seperate /home directory?????
depends on what you want to do,  can be useful if  you don't have for example an external hard disk to back stuff up on to
or if you don't want to have to move data into another partition,  when you want to sort out a partition set up
I would suggest clean installing  pete_  ,because of the default Ext4 file system :)  and how the  Ext3 to Ext4 conversion may not  be good enough for full Ext4 support
set it up so you got Ext4?  nice and fast to boot and that?   if so I guess then it's just upgrade and  things are fine
yea its real fast, but my home is still on my /
have you got an external hard disk?
do i need one for this, i thought not
well  if in the future you have a reason to re install  Ubuntu,   if you have a seperate home things become easier
,but if you can back up your stuff else where anyway for example an external hard disk, a seperate Home isn't really needed
